Create AWS Security Credentials

Execute the following steps to create the AWS security credentials required to enable video streaming:

  1. Login to the AWS kinesis portal: https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/kinesisvideo/home?region=us-east-1#/dashboard

Figure 17: Login to AWS kinesis portal

  1. Create a user group.

Figure 18: Create user group

  1. Click on Create user.

Figure 19: Create user

  1. Provide the new user name and click on Next.

Figure 20: Enter user name

  1. Add the user to the user group created in step 2 and click Next. Ensure to provide access to the video streaming resources in the policy. For example:

{

“Version”: “2012-10-17”,

“Statement”: [

{

“Effect”: “Allow”,

“Action”: “*”,

“Resource”: “*”

}

]

}

Figure 21: Extend permissions

  1. Select the user created previously and click on Create access key.

Figure 22: Create access key for the user

  1. Select the option Application running on an AWS compute service, check the confirmation box and click Next.

Figure 23: Application running on AWS compute service

  1. Click on Create access key.

Figure 24: Create access key

  1. Copy the generated access key, secret access key and click Done.

Figure 25: Access and secret access key

  1. Click on the Kinesis Video Streams (search for Kinesis Video Streams in the search bar).

Figure 26: Kinesis video streams

  1. Click on Create signaling channel.

Figure 27: Create signaling channel

  1. Provide a name to the new signaling channel and click on Create signaling channel.

Figure 28: Enter signaling channel name

  1. A new signaling channel will be created. Copy the Signaling channel ARN.

Figure 29: Signaling channel ARN

  1. Upon successfully initiating video streaming from the Host, video streaming will be available under Media player viewer.
